title: HOW TO BUILD THE ULTIMATE NO-TILL GARDEN: USING COVER CROPS AS A SHEET MULCH!

tasks.task: Construct a no-till garden using tarps and cover crops.
subtasks: Plan the garden layout using string to outline 30 inch beds and 14 inch walkways.
Apply a silage tarp to the garden area to kill existing vegetation and weeds.
Broadcast rye grass seed over the tarp-covered soil and allow it to grow to a significant height.
Crimp the mature cover crop using a pallet or similar tool to create a flat mulch layer.
Add compost to the 30 inch beds, applying it at a depth of six to eight inches.
Cover the garden with a silage tarp to kill emerging weeds and retain soil moisture.

tasks.task: Seed the beds with desired vegetables or crops after preparing the no-till garden.
subtasks: Evenly distribute and plant seeds according to the garden layout and crop requirements.
Water and maintain the newly planted beds.
